meanings.definition: The property of being distributive or distributable.
meanings.sent1: The distributivity of the resources among the team members was fair.
meanings.sent2: The distributivity of the profits ensured everyone received an equal share.
meanings.sent3: The distributivity of the snacks at the party made everyone happy.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness had a distributivity that spread warmth to all around her.
meanings.sent5: The distributivity of knowledge is essential for a well-informed society.

meanings.definition: The quality of being distributive or distributable.
meanings.sent1: The distributivity of the tasks made the project run smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The distributivity of the funds allowed for efficient budgeting.
meanings.sent3: The distributivity of the jokes in the movie kept the audience laughing.
meanings.sent4: His leadership had a distributivity that inspired teamwork.
meanings.sent5: The distributivity of opportunities is crucial for a fair society.
